image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Who is Santino Pietrosanti, creator of Jaguar's 'woke' ad that has sparked major row
item.description: Jaguar, the British car company, faced criticism for its latest advertisement campaign, "Copy Nothing," which features models instead of cars. Santino Pietrosanti, Jaguar's head of brand, defended the rebranding as a celebration of diversity and originality. While some praised the move, others criticized it as pandering to a "woke" agenda.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk denies Time magazine's cover page checklist featuring him: 'I am trying to make life multiplanetary'
item.description: Elon Musk refuted a Time magazine cover story featuring a "to-do list" attributed to him, clarifying he gave no interviews nor confirmed the listed items. Musk emphasized his main focus remains on making life multiplanetary to extend consciousness's potential lifespan, noting some items on the list align with that goal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chicago bar owners rally against Mayor Johnson over proposed 35% liquor tax hike
item.description: Chicago bar and restaurant owners are protesting Mayor Brandon Johnson's proposed 35% liquor tax hike, arguing it will cripple businesses already struggling with inflation and the pandemic's aftermath. They warn the increase will burden consumers and benefit suburban competitors while failing to meaningfully address the city's budget deficit.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump picks ex congressman Pete Hoekstra as ambassador to Canada
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has nominated former Congressman Pete Hoekstra as the United States Ambassador to Canada. Hoekstra, who previously served as US Ambassador to the Netherlands during Trump's first term, expressed honor at the nomination.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia launches ICBM strike against Ukraine as war escalates
item.description: Russia launched an ICBM from the Astrakhan region, targeting Dnipro in Ukraine. This marks the first use of such a weapon in the ongoing conflict. The attack, which also involved Kh-101 cruise missiles, follows Ukraine's use of Western-supplied long-range missiles against targets within Russia. Moscow had previously warned that such actions would be considered a major escalation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Want asylum before Trump takes power': Migrants set out from Mexico hoping to reach pre-Don US
item.description: Driven by anxiety over Donald Trump's impending presidency and his stringent immigration policies, a large group of approximately 1,500 migrants have embarked on a grueling journey from Tapachula, Mexico. Their goal is to reach the US border and seek asylum before Trump assumes office in January.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US: Former New York doctor sentenced to life imprisonment for sexually abusing patients
item.description: Darius Paduch, a former New York doctor, was sentenced to life in prison for sexually abusing numerous patients, including minors, over a span of twelve years. Paduch exploited his position at prominent Manhattan and Long Island hospitals, assaulting patients during exams and employing manipulative tactics.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Florida man arrested for planning to bomb the New York Stock Exchange
item.description: A Florida man was arrested for allegedly plotting to bomb the New York Stock Exchange. He wanted to detonate a bomb during Thanksgiving week. The FBI found bomb-making materials in his storage unit. He had been researching explosives online since 2017. The man aimed to 'reset' the US government. He believed the US was ready for a revolution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Volcano erupts again in Iceland, seventh eruption this year
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US President-elect Donald Trump likely to pick Johns Hopkins surgeon Martin Makary to lead FDA, sources say
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy Party: Sean Combs had keys to all the bedrooms, reveals property manager
item.description: Speaking about this specific party, Jason revealed that Diddy's team requested double-sided locks in bedrooms. The party took place on May 3, 2014 and there was a rampant cocaine use with broken bottles and condom wrappers left all over the property, The Mirror reported. "The bedrooms the following day were disgusting, broken bottles of alcohol, used condoms, blood on the beddings, powder and razor blades by the hundreds, lubricant on the dressers, marble floors," Jason said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Joe Scarborough CONFIRMS Trump concerned over Pete Hegseth; team looking for alternative
item.description: Pete Hegseth is a military veteran and a former Fox News host who was infamous for his problematic opinions. But his record was otherwise clean. After his nomination, it emerged that he paid off a woman in 2017 who accused him of sexual assault. This is not like the allegation against Matt Haetz but the Trump team was caught off guard here and they believe they were not told everything by Hegseth.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 12 soldiers, 6 terrorists killed in terror attack in northwest Pakistan
item.description: At least 12 Pakistani soldiers and six terrorists were killed in a clash at a joint check post in Bannu district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. The terrorists attempted to storm the post, triggering a firefight and a suicide bombing that resulted in the soldiers' deaths. The incident follows a recent surge in attacks on security forces in the region.
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: Pakistan approves military offensive against separatists in Balochistan
item.description: Pakistan is gearing up for a full-scale military operation in Balochistan to counter a surge in attacks on civilians and foreign nationals. The operation targets separatist groups, including the Majeed Brigade, BLA, BLF, and BRAS, who are accused of undermining Pakistan's security and economic progress at the behest of hostile foreign powers.
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: Is Barron Trump not a US citizen under Donald's immigration plan? Claim viral on social media
item.description: Donald Trump's plan to end birthright citizenship will only affect children born to parents who are in the US illegally. If either of the parents is a green card holder, the child automatically becomes a US citizen. Fake claims are doing the rounds that Barron Trump is not a US citizen because Melania was not a US citizen when Barron was born. Melania was not an illegal immigrant and Donald Trump was a legal resident when Barron was born.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
